page.description: Executes the statements for the first logical expression that evaluates to TRUE.
page.syntax: IF Logical_Expression1 [ THEN ] [ Statements1 ] [ ELSEIF Logical_Expression2 [ THEN ] [ Statements2 ]] ... [ ELSEIF Logical_ExpressionN [ THEN ] [ StatementsN ]] [ ELSE [ Statements ]] END IF

argument.name: Logical_Expression1
argument.description: An expression that evaluates to .T. (TRUE) or .F. (FALSE).

argument.name: Logical_Expression2 ... Logical_ExpressionN
argument.description: Optional. Expressions that evaluates to .T. (TRUE) or .F. (FALSE).

page.discussion: IF ... THEN ... ELSE is a conditional control structure, executing the statements for the first logical expression that evaluates to TRUE. If no expression evaluates to TRUE, statements supplied after the else clause are executed. IMPORTANT: The then and else clauses must be the last words on the line. SELECT ... CASE, IIF(), CASE()

section.description: Associate a grade with a score. Any score below 60 is an F.
section.example:
FUNCTION test_grade as C(score as N) if score > = 90 then grade = "A" elseif score > = 80 then grade = "B" elseif score > = 70 then sp; grade = "C"
elseif score > = 60 then grade = "D" else grade = "F" end if test_grade = grade end FUNCTION
